poem:
"Reflections on Silver Screen Love"

In the spun sugar morning light,
a romcom tango scribed in black ink.
Two hearts knotted by Coachella flair,
a dance of age, unbothered by the disparity.
He, a boyband cherub wrapped in greying wool,
She, a stylish, single star not reaching too far.
Together their chemistry ignites the expansive stage,
In this sleek theatre of yearning, a spectacle I engage.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
